page.title: 19HISTORICAL FEATURES
page.content:
MOUNT & BAILEY FORTRESS: the mount remains and plans of the earthworks exist (W. Johnson's "Byways in British Archeology", 1912); Norman type, probably commissioned by one of the de Veres who owned the parish at the time of the Domesday Book, 1086.
ICE HOUSE: 18C. brick-built, domed construction. Ice taken from the nearby frozen lake was stored in straw. The main part of the house is below ground;the dome rises approx. 5 ft. above ground and is about 6 ft. in diameter.
WHIPPING POST: age unknown - near the Forge.
